page.title: 01NEW HARTLEY
page.content: {New Hartley} is on the North East coast of England. It is 10 miles from{ {Newcastle Upon Tyne} and 5 miles from the market town and port of{Blyth. The name{New Hartley}came from{ {Hartley} which is now part of{Seaton {Sluice.}In Hartley there was a coal mine. When this mine closed in{1840} the whole community moved inland to a new mine and village which became{New {Hartley. { }At first there were only 3 rows of houses: Long Row, Double Row and Cross Row. The village as it is in l985 only developed after the{Pit Disaster}of{ {l862.}Only part of Double Row still stands to show what the earliest houses were like. The rest of the village has been completely redeveloped and has been built since 1914. (CONTINUED)
